column4: help! I installed the latest nvidia drivers and now i'm forced to start in "low graphics mode"
how do I roll back?
can anyone help? I installed the latest nvidia drivers and now i'm forced to start in "low graphics mode"
which driver version
nvidia driver 169.12
oops nvidia--xconfig -A
so I type in  nvidia-xconfig -A and then what? i'm confused
i see something about virtual resolution, is that what I want?
what res do have know?
i mean pixels   try nvidia-xserver ot nvidia-xsettings
dpkg-reconfigure-xserver
nvidia-settings
nvidia-settings is giving me an error: you do not appear to be running the Nvidia X driver
but if I do nvidia-xconfig and then restart X, it boots into low-res mode
do you get an nvidia logo on boot?
did you reconfigure your x server dpkg-reconfigure-xserver ?
i just did the reconfiguring, should I restart X?
i'll restart X and then come back
: set you screen size 1st !
read the info for debian/ubuntu here http://www.nvnews.net/vbulletin/showthread.php?t=72490  and you'll be good to go
